docs.abstract: Faced with the high cost of egg-freezing in their home countries, some women are going abroad for a better deal, and a vacation.
docs.snippet: Faced with the high cost of egg-freezing in their home countries, some women are going abroad for a better deal, and a vacation.
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s hardly uncommon for Americans to travel to London over the summer, where they watch tennis at Wimbledon, say, or take pictures of Big Ben or dine on champagne and scones at Claridge’s.

headline.main: Have Eggs, Will Travel. To Freeze Them.
headline.print_headline: Have Eggs, Will Travel. To Freeze Them.

docs.abstract: Processing times for new and renewed passports have increased again. The updated timeline, 10 to 13 weeks, leaves some would-be travelers feeling desperate.
docs.snippet: Processing times for new and renewed passports have increased again. The updated timeline, 10 to 13 weeks, leaves some would-be travelers feeling desperate.
docs.lead_paragraph: With international travel beckoning this summer, Americans applying for new or renewed passports will have to practice patience: The State Department warned that it will take even longer to get their documents.

headline.main: Hoping to Travel Abroad? Don’t Put Off Your Passport Application.
headline.print_headline: Hoping to Travel Abroad? Passport Applications Face a Processing Backlog.

docs.abstract: Parents often have high hopes when they take their children on vacations. But do kids see what their parents expect them to see? We tried to find out.
docs.snippet: Parents often have high hopes when they take their children on vacations. But do kids see what their parents expect them to see? We tried to find out.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last summer, while preparing a travel essay about my childhood years in Budapest, I spent some time revisiting my family’s old home videos.

headline.main: Capturing a Kid’s-Eye View of Travel
headline.print_headline: As a Child, What Did I Get From Travel?

docs.abstract: Google Flights is joining other booking platforms that aim to assure travelers they’re getting the best price.
docs.snippet: Google Flights is joining other booking platforms that aim to assure travelers they’re getting the best price.
docs.lead_paragraph: To buy or to wait? Given the wild fluctuations of airfare prices, that is a frugal flier’s persistent dilemma. A fare found today may tick up tomorrow, double next week or fall.

headline.main: Looking for the Best Deal on Airfares? Consider a Price Freeze.

docs.abstract: We spoke to readers about their recent solo travels, including their motivations to travel alone and what they chose to spend on.
docs.snippet: We spoke to readers about their recent solo travels, including their motivations to travel alone and what they chose to spend on.
docs.lead_paragraph: Solo travel — curating a vacation perfectly suited to you and no one else — is the ultimate idiosyncratic experience.

headline.main: How Much Did You Spend on Your Solo Vacation?

docs.abstract: The airline, which experienced a large meltdown around Christmas, resumed departures after suffering from technology problems.
docs.snippet: The airline, which experienced a large meltdown around Christmas, resumed departures after suffering from technology problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: Southwest Airlines said late Tuesday morning that flights had resumed after a brief pause caused by a technological problem.

headline.main: Southwest Airlines Briefly Halts Takeoff of Flights

docs.abstract: An alternative coronation tour explores the psyche and history of the new king, from the gardens he created to the London hotel he used as the backdrop for his coming out with the new Queen Consort.
docs.snippet: An alternative coronation tour explores the psyche and history of the new king, from the gardens he created to the London hotel he used as the backdrop for his coming out with the new Queen Consort.
docs.lead_paragraph: No royal heir in British history has waited longer than Charles III, the king formerly known as the Prince of Wales, to ascend the throne. When he is officially crowned, on May 6, Charles will be 74 years old — a full 47 years older than his mother, Elizabeth II, was at her own coronation way back in the mid-20th century.

headline.main: In the Footsteps of Charles III

docs.abstract: Suva, the Fijian capital, is not on many travelers’ itineraries, but with a multiethnic population from all over the country and the region, it defines the urban South Pacific.
docs.snippet: Suva, the Fijian capital, is not on many travelers’ itineraries, but with a multiethnic population from all over the country and the region, it defines the urban South Pacific.
docs.lead_paragraph: After I checked into the Grand Pacific Hotel in Suva, Fiji’s capital, a colonial-era lodging so iconic that locals call it simply G.P.H., I walked outside along Victoria Parade, the wide boulevard in front. Many of the people I encountered smiled, waved and shouted “Bula,” a greeting. I passed a lively cricket pitch, then skirted around Parliament. An older, sprightly gentleman made a beeline for me. “Sir, you must be very careful here. People will rob you,” he said, then paused. “But I can protect you.”

headline.main: On an Island Paradise, Seeking Out a City’s Complexity

docs.abstract: The charm of the maritime city’s colorful-tile-wrapped facades and hilly, sun-warmed streets remains strong, even as it enjoys a popularity boom.
docs.snippet: The charm of the maritime city’s colorful-tile-wrapped facades and hilly, sun-warmed streets remains strong, even as it enjoys a popularity boom.
docs.lead_paragraph: The charm of the maritime city’s colorful-tile-wrapped facades and hilly, sun-warmed streets remains strong, even as it enjoys a popularity boom.

docs.abstract: Plus: Zoya Cherkassky’s paintings focused on the African diaspora, a playful and eclectic hotel in Oslo — and more recommendations from T Magazine.
docs.snippet: Plus: Zoya Cherkassky’s paintings focused on the African diaspora, a playful and eclectic hotel in Oslo — and more recommendations from T Magazine.
docs.lead_paragraph: Oslo has been ambitiously reinventing itself in the last few years; dramatic new architectural monuments like the National Museum and the Deichman Bjørvika library are invigorating the harbor city. And this week marks the arrival of a sensational place to stay: the 11-room Villa Inkognito in Oslo’s elegant Frogner neighborhood. A black-and-white entrance hall gives way to colorful public spaces, making plain that its interior designers — Adam Greco and Alice Lund, the duo behind the studio GrecoDeco — had fun as they updated the former residence from the 1870s. Every room is a joyful mash up of historically inspired wallpapers, jewel-toned painted walls, wood paneling and a mix of antique and custom-designed furniture. “We wanted to keep some of its original Victorian-style interiors but also add some inspiration from other design movements at that time: Art Nouveau, English Arts and Crafts movement and the trend of collecting objects from Asia,” says Greco. Although the Villa is technically part of the six-month-old Sommerro hotel (the main building, also designed by GrecoDeco, houses 231 rooms with an Art Deco public bath and swimming pool) and is connected to it by a discreet walkway, it was designed to be its own intimate space with access to a private kitchen and chef. The ground floor is made up of common rooms including Spectre, an honesty bar with silver gilded walls and tiles of salvaged golden onyx. Greco hopes that guests feel like they’re “staying in an eccentric private mansion.” From $615 a night, villainkognito.com.

headline.main: A Mexican Boutique With Penguin Saltshakers and Nopal Coin Purses
